alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie County; Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; North Snowy Range Foothills; South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: High Wind Watch issued November 30 at 2:12PM MST until December 05 at 2:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH LATE MONDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...A prolonged period of strong westerly winds likely. West winds 35 to 50 MPH with gusts 70 to 80 MPH possible at times. * WHERE...North Snowy Range Foothills including Arlington and Elk Mountain along Interstate 80 between Laramie and Rawlins, Central Laramie Range including Bordeaux along Interstate 25 between Chugwater and Wheatland, South Laramie Range and Adjacent Foothills including Interstate 80 between Laramie and Cheyenne. This also includes central Laramie County including the city of Cheyenne. * WHEN...5 AM MST Saturday until 5 AM MST Tuesday. Wind gusts may frequently exceed 50 MPH through much of this period. * IMPACTS...Mainly to transportation. Strong cross winds will be hazardous to light weight or high profile vehicles, including campers and tractor trailers.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this situation. Fasten loose objects or shelter objects in a safe location prior to the onset of winds.

area.areaDesc: Central Laramie County; Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; North Snowy Range Foothills; South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills
